message: I have a great product for you, Bob. I'm excited to offer it to you at a price of $180. I think it's a fair price considering its value to you.
I'm interested in the product, but $180 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $100.
I understand that $180 is a bit steep, but I still think the product is worth more than $100. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $140. Is that something you'd be interested in?
I appreciate your willingness to meet in the middle, but I'm still a bit hesitant about the price. I'm willing to go up to $110, but that's as high as I'm willing to go.

I understand that you're willing to go up to $110, but I'm still not convinced that's enough. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my target. I'll offer it to you for $145. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.

I understand that you're not willing to go any lower, but I'm still interested in the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $110 and $145, which would be $127.50. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I'm not willing to meet Bob halfway, but I'm willing to make another counteroffer. I'll offer it to him for $150. This is getting close to my target, and I'm not sure if I'm willing to go any lower.
I'm starting to think that we're getting a bit far apart. I'm willing to go up to $125, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. Can you meet me at that price?
I'm not willing to meet Bob at $125, but I'm willing to make one last push. I'll offer it to him for $155. This is my absolute final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.

I think we've gone back and forth long enough. I'm willing to walk away if we can't agree on a price. I'll make one last offer: $130. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll buy the product from John for $120.
